#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat

#Text=Change Your Apple ID
#Text=This wikiHow teaches you how to change the email address that you use to sign in to iCloud , the iTunes Store , and across Apple devices and services .
#Text=If your Apple ID ends in @mac.com , @me.com , or @iCloud.com , it cannot be changed .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Using a Web Browser
#Text=Sign out of Apple ID .
#Text=Do so on all devices and services , such as iCloud and iTunes , that you 're signed into with your current Apple ID .
#Text=Go to the Apple ID website .
#Text=Do so by clicking the link to the left or by typing appleid.apple.com in the search field of any Internet-connected Web browser .
#Text=Enter your current Apple ID and password in the labeled fields .
#Text=Click on or tap ➲ .
#Text=It 's on the right side of the " Password " field .
#Text=If you have two-step verification enabled , tap or click on " Allow " on another device , then enter the six-digit code in the spaces on the screen .
#Text=Click on or tap .
#Text=It 's a blue link on the right side of the screen under the " Account " section .
#Text=Click on or tap .
#Text=It 's next to the email address under the " APPLE ID " section at the top of the window .
#Text=If your Apple ID ends in @mac.com , @me.com , or @iCloud.com , you will not see this option .
#Text=Enter a new email address .
#Text=Use an address that 's neither already associated with an Apple ID nor likely to change soon .
#Text=If prompted , answer the security questions you set up with your Apple ID .
#Text=Click on or tap .
#Text=Apple will send an email with a verification code to your new email address .
#Text=The button may read Continue , depending on the browser you 're using .
#Text=Check your email .
#Text=Look for the message sent by Apple .
#Text=Enter the verification code .
#Text=Type the code from the email message in the spaces that appear in the browser window .
#Text=Sign in with your new Apple ID .
#Text=You can now sign back in to your devices and Apple services with your new Apple ID .
#Text=If you have two-step verification enabled , tap or click on " Allow " on another device , then enter the six-digit code in the spaces on the screen .
#Text=Using iPhone or iPad Running iOS 10.3
#Text=Sign out of Apple ID .
#Text=Do so on all devices and services , such as iCloud and iTunes , that you 're signed into with your current Apple ID , EXCEPT the device you 're using to change your Apple ID .
#Text=Open Settings .
#Text=It 's a gray app with gears ( ⚙️ ) that 's typically located on your home screen .
#Text=Tap your Apple ID .
#Text=It 's the section at the top of the screen that contains your name and image , if you 've added one .
#Text=Tap .
#Text=It 's at the top of the first section .
#Text=Tap .
#Text=It 's a blue link on the right side of the screen next to " REACHABLE AT .

#Text=Swipe left on your current Apple ID .

#Text=It 's the first email address in the list , with the words  Apple ID " in small text just below it .

column1: #Text=On some devices , you may need to tap a " - " next to the email address rather than swiping left .
#Text=If your Apple ID ends in @mac.com , @me.com , or @iCloud.com , you will not be able to swipe left .
#Text=Tap .
#Text=It 's a red button to the right of your Apple ID .
#Text=Tap .
#Text=You 'll be prompted to choose another email address already associated with your Apple ID , if there is one , or to enter a new email address .
#Text=Enter a new email address .
#Text=Use an address that 's neither already associated with an Apple ID nor likely to change soon .
#Text=If prompted , answer the security questions you set up with your Apple ID or your Apple ID password .
#Text=Click on .
#Text=Apple will send an email with a verification code to your new email address .
#Text=Check your email .
#Text=Look for the message sent by Apple .
#Text=Enter the verification code .
#Text=Type the code from the email message in the spaces that appear on your device 's screen .
#Text=Sign in with your new Apple ID .
#Text=You can now sign back in to your devices and Apple services with your new Apple ID .
#Text=If you have two-step verification enabled , tap or click on " Allow " on another device , then enter the six-digit code in the spaces on the screen .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Apple recommends you use your primary email address for your Apple ID .
